summary: This document is an email from Jes Staley discussing the need to go on television to defend hedge funds, as suggested by Daley and Frankel. The email is addressed to multiple recipients, indicating a discussion among colleagues regarding public relations strategies.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is the sender of the email discussing the need to defend hedge funds on television.

persons.name: Joseph Evangelisti
persons.context: Joseph Evangelisti is one of the recipients of the email from Jes Staley.

persons.name: Kristin C Lemkau
persons.context: Kristin C Lemkau is another recipient of the email from Jes Staley.

persons.name: Daley
persons.context: Daley is mentioned as suggesting that Jes Staley should go on TV to defend the hedge funds.

persons.name: Frankel
persons.context: Frankel is also mentioned as advising Jes Staley to go on TV to defend the hedge funds.

connections.description: Jes Staley and Joseph Evangelisti are colleagues discussing hedge fund defense strategies.
Jes Staley and Kristin C Lemkau are colleagues involved in the discussion about hedge fund defense.
Daley advises Jes Staley to go on TV to defend hedge funds.
Frankel also advises Jes Staley regarding the hedge fund defense on TV.

keyFacts: Jes Staley is considering going on TV to defend hedge funds based on advice from Daley and Frankel.
The email was sent on January 28, 2010.
The email includes multiple recipients indicating a collaborative discussion.
